intro: Racosperma daviesii, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Racosperma daviesii plays an important role in its ecosystem by fixing nitrogen in the soil, benefiting other plant growth.
